3.0 out of 5 stars
Excellent game but a big letdown on PC platform
ByNikit S.on 8 May 2015
Hardware Platform: Pc
|
Verified Purchase
This was one game which I was waiting eagerly to get my hands on. Once I got it finally to my horror you had download the entire 35 GB of game in 29 parts adds to that a recently released patch of 15.8 GB. Since this is India & not US where there is allowance of much liberal internet usage- a fact which the developers could have taken into account. This humongous download was a big let letdown even if you can play the game with limited capabilities till the rest of the files are downloaded in background. Make no mistake the game is superbly designed & fun to play but on PC platform it does come with it's baggage of problems
Comment

4.0 out of 5 stars
Buy only if you have fast internet with large bandwidth!!!!
ByKarthic T Uon 30 April 2015
Hardware Platform: Pc
The game is a masterpiece with top graphics and storyline. Combat, online gameplay faction amd Arena Interaction are all great. But the problem is, to enjoy it you have to download nearly 30+ GB of game data from the internet. Its really annoying to have purchased a physical copy of the game and still download such huge amount of data unlike the GTA 5. The only difference between the Steam copy and physical copy is that you actually pay less to the latter. Go ahead and buy the game if you are a fan of fighting games and ONLY if you have a large bandwidth with decent speed. Any players feel free to add me on Steam - karthictu
Comment
|

5.0 out of 5 stars
5 stars for the game not the product!!!
ByJacobon 8 March 2017
Hardware Platform: Pc
|
Verified Purchase
I had no option left but to purchase a PC version of the game since PS4 was so expensive and I already owned a PS3. Thanks to Sony they ruined my happiness with Steam (absolute nonsense platform) which forces its users to download obscene amount of data given our Internet provider speeds. It's as good as downloading 3-4 games at once which will slow you down until you lose all interest in the game. I have hardly played this game to my satisfaction and its asks for an update which takes eons to complete. I have uninstalled the game and god forsaken Steam from my computer for good. Never again will I go for Steam. Had to let out some steam myself!!!

2.0 out of 5 stars
Stunning gameplay, 30 GB download required for installation!
BySameer D.on 4 May 2015
Hardware Platform: Pc
|
Verified Purchase
The 2 stars are for the amazing gameplay and the bonus Goro DLC that came with the pack. I hate that one has to download a 30 GB patch/installation for this to work. It seems a lot easier to provide 4 extra DVDs with the box. They seriously need to rethink their distribution. It took forever to download. Once it got installed, it was pure awesomeness.
Note: I bought this from Cloudtail first, wherein I received a used product which wasn't wrapped in plastic and did not have anything (Serial Key) inside except the DVD. I returned it and was promptly refunded my money. I don't mean to tarnish the seller's image here as I have ordered other products worth a lot more and have been satisfied. But should anyone receive such a product, do return it promptly.
Comment

3.0 out of 5 stars
It's Good, but the price is a bit too high. A couple of months wait, might bring in some Discounts.
BySunil M.on 16 July 2015
Hardware Platform: Xbox One
The first time I had played the Mortal Kombat game was on my old school gaming platform SEGA. That time I was hooked onto the game, the first time I laid my eyes on it. The graphics and the controls, and all the fatalities were amazing. Fast forward to 20 years later, and we have the Mortal Kombat X for the Xbox One. I am an avid Call of Duty gamer, and also play sport games as well like FIFA, NBA, Racing and more. The graphics on the Mortal Kombat X are really good and very detailed, and at times to the extent of being graphic. The bones cracking, spine crunching, eye ball gouging, head splitting, ball crunching moves are all good. However, after the first 4-5 times of playing it, I got bored. There is a storyline added to the game to make it interesting, but it still becomes monotonous. After 20 years, I would have expected something more than just an addition in storyline. When Call of Duty can bring something new year after year, I would have expected that Mortal Kombat would have been loaded with awesome stuff. But it does not. Otherwise, it was an ok game to play. Brings back memories to fight with the old players like Liu Kang, Rayden, Johny Cage and more. Compared to the Sega systems, the fatality combinations are much easier. It is costly for the level of eagerness if would generate once you have the game. I would prefer to play a game of COD multiplayer or FIFA multiplayer than put in the CD for Mortal Kombat.
Comment
|

3.0 out of 5 stars
PLEASE READ IT , HELP YOU IN TAKING RIGHT DECISION
ByRAJATon 18 April 2015
Hardware Platform: Pc
THIS GAME IS ONE OF THE BEST IN SERIES,BUT HAS A CON COMING WITH IT IF YOU ARE BUYING RETAIL DISK.WHEN YOU BUY RETAIL A RETAIL DISK YOU EXPECT THAT ALL THE GAME CONTENT GET TO YOU LOADED INTO DVDS BUT WHEN YOU WILL RECEIVE THE COPY OF THIS GAME YOU ONLY GET A SINGLE DVD CONTAINING LESS THAN 1.5 GB'S GAME CONTENT AND THE REST OF THE GAME YOU WILL HAVE TO DOWNLOAD FROM STEAM AND THE SIZE YOU HAVE TO DOWNLOAD IS AROUND 33 GB'S.THIS WILL NOT BE A PROBLEM IF WE ARE LIVING IN SOME WESTERN COUNTRY WERE THEY HAVE TO PAY $20( Rs 1200 ) FOR 25 MB UNLIMITED INTERNET.BUT WE ARE LIVING IN INDIA WHERE FOR 1 Mb INTERNET PLAN WHICH GIVE DOWNLOAD SPEED OF 128 KB/S WE HAVE TO PAY RS 1200.WE THIS SUCKY SPEED IT TOOK ME MORE THEN 80 HR'S TO GET THIS GAME IN TO MY PC,AD GUESS WHERE DO I LIVE ,I LIVE AT NEW DELHI WHICH IS UNFORTUNATELY CAPITAL OF INDIA.SO UNLESS YOU ARE SOME RICH MAN WHO CAN AFFORD A NET PLAN WHICH DOWNLOADS THIS GAME IN LESS THAN 10 HR'S(BECAUSE AFTER 10 HR'S SEEING THIS THING GETTING DOWNLOAD WILL BE VERY FRUSTRATING) MY OPINION IS NOT TO GO FOR IT.

5.0 out of 5 stars
Mortal Kombat X Review - Your Very Own Kung Fu Flick
BySathishon 14 April 2015
Hardware Platform: Playstation 4
Mortal Kombat X offers the best story mode I've ever personally seen in a fighting game. Its cohesive plot and extended cinematics makes you feel much more like a participant in a film than a player on the couch. The fighting is frantic, fluid, and dynamic, with the glorious goriness of the X-Ray moves often turning the tides of battle.
An absolute must for franchise fans, and a really stellar bet for general fighting game fans, even those who just appreciate a good story will find a lot to love in Mortal Kombat X.
